  • Method Details

    • getEncounterState

      public EncounterManager.EncounterState getEncounterState()
      Retrieves the current state of encounters in the dungeon.

      The EncounterManager.EncounterState object provides details about:

      • The coordinates of active encounters such as traps, Mad Scientists, Lost Explorers, and Guardians.
      • The status flags indicating whether specific encounters have occurred or been completed.
      Returns:
      the EncounterManager.EncounterState object containing the current encounter state

    • assignEncounters

      public void assignEncounters(char[][] level)
      Assigns encounters to specific rooms in the current dungeon level.
      • Encounters Assigned:
        • Trap: Always assigned.
        • Mad Scientist: Always assigned.
        • Lost Explorer: Assigned only in Level 2.
        • Guardian: Assigned only in Level 3.
      • Assignment Rules:
        • Encounters cannot overlap with each other or non-walkable areas like walls ('W').
        • The Guardian is placed in a walkable room (' ') in Level 3.
      • Reset States:
        • Resets encounter states (e.g., trap encountered, Mad Scientist encountered).
        • Resets the Guardian's completion state.
      Internal Method Calls:
      • getValidEncounterRoom(char[][], Random)
      • DungeonMap.getCurrentLevelNumber()
      • EncounterManager.EncounterState.setTrapRoom(int, int)
      • EncounterManager.EncounterState.setMadScientistRoom(int, int)
      • EncounterManager.EncounterState.setExplorerRoom(int, int)
      • EncounterManager.EncounterState.setGuardianRoom(int, int)
      Parameters:
      level - the current dungeon level represented as a 2D character array

    • checkForEncounters

      public void checkForEncounters(PositionDataHolder pm, PlayerDataHolder player, InventoryManager inventoryManager)
      Checks whether the player has entered a room with an encounter and triggers the appropriate encounter.
      Parameters:
      pm - the player's position manager
      player - the player's data holder
